intro: Esenbeckia tehuana, commonly known as the Mexican moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Esenbeckia tehuana is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
